definition: to succeed by a lucky stroke
to sprain (one's ankle) (Tw)
askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: He didn't hit out, but hit the wicket by a fluke.
sentences.chinese: 他并未用力击球，却歪打正着击中了三柱门。

sentences.english: The potato chips were invented by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 土豆条的发明纯属歪打正着。

definition: accidentally/to act before thinking
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
a blind cat finds a dead mouse (idiom)/blind luck

definition: (idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
curious coincidence
fortuitously/luckily/as chance has it
to miscalculate/miscalculation
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
exactly what one wants
God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes

definition: contrary to expectation/unexpected
by chance/by coincidence/to happen to
